Integrate Vercel Speed Insights with Performance Metrics Ticker

Added Vercel Speed Insights tracking and integrated real Web Vitals performance metrics into the status bar ticker.

- Installed @vercel/speed-insights package for performance tracking
- Added <SpeedInsights /> component to App.jsx

- Captures real performance metrics: LCP, FCP, CLS, TTFB
- Metrics update in real-time as page loads

- Expanded ticker from 4 to 7 rotating statistics
- Added 3 new performance metric displays:

  - [FCP] First Contentful Paint (initial render)

1. Users Online
2. Avg Response Time
3. Queries Processed Today
4. System Uptime
5. LCP Performance
6. FCP Performance
7. CLS Score

**Benefits:**
- Real performance visibility in the UI
- Vercel dashboard integration for analytics
- Live metrics from actual user experience
- Performance monitoring without leaving the app

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Fix AI Message Display - Natural Text Instead of JSON

Fixed AI messages displaying as raw JSON by improving response parsing and updating text styling for natural appearance.

**Chatbot Service Fix:**
- Added support for .text field in API responses
- Extended response parsing to handle common formats:
  - .text (n8n webhook format)
  - .content (common AI format)
  - .reply (chat format)
  - .answer (Q&A format)
- Now extracts clean text before falling back to stringify

**Message Styling Enhancement:**
- Changed message text font from monospace to Inter (natural sans-serif)
- Improved readability with proper font family
- Maintains conversational appearance
- Preserves cyberpunk aesthetic with glassmorphic bubbles

**Result:**
- Before: {"text":"Hello! How can I assist you today?"}
- After: Hello! How can I assist you today!

Messages now display naturally like human conversation instead of machine code.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Integrate Supabase Authentication & Remove AI Insights Sidebar

Implemented full JWT-based authentication using Supabase and cleaned up the UI by removing the Neural Sidebar panel.

**Supabase Authentication Integration:**
- Installed @supabase/supabase-js package
- Created Supabase client service with auto-refresh and session persistence
- Updated authService to use Supabase methods (signInWithPassword, signUp, signOut)
- Enhanced AuthContext with session management and onAuthStateChange listener
- Added email confirmation redirect configuration
- Updated ProtectedRoute to check Supabase session instead of localStorage token
- Built functional Login page with form validation and error handling
- Created Register page with password confirmation and email verification
- Added register route to App routing

**Post-Login Flow:**
- Users redirected to landing page (/) after successful login/registration
- Welcome HUD automatically shown by clearing localStorage flags
- Boot sequence skipped on subsequent logins

**UI Cleanup - Remove AI Insights Sidebar:**
- Deleted NeuralSidebar.jsx component and NeuralSidebar.css stylesheet
- Removed all sidebar references from MatrixChat.jsx
- Removed sidebar state and toggle functionality
- Terminal window no longer has sidebar-dependent styling

**Logout Button Implementation:**
- Added logout button to terminal header (top-right corner)
- Styled with cyberpunk cyan theme matching existing design
- Power icon (⏻) + "Logout" text with responsive behavior
- Glassmorphic button with hover effects and cyan glow
- Logout handler clears Supabase session and localStorage flags
- Redirects to /app/login after logout
- Only visible when user is authenticated

**Technical Details:**
- JWT tokens managed automatically by Supabase with auto-refresh
- Session persisted across browser tabs
- Axios interceptor updated to use Supabase access tokens
- Graceful handling of missing Supabase credentials (dev mode)
- Row Level Security ready for production use
